text.section:
In this section, "foreign charitable organization or representative" means a charitable organization or charitable representative who:
has its principal place of business out of state; or
is organized under the laws of another state.

By soliciting a charitable contribution in the State, a foreign charitable organization or representative irrevocably appoints the Secretary of State as agent to receive a subpoena, summons, or other process that is:
issued in an action brought under this title; and
directed to:
the foreign charitable organization or representative; or
a partner, principal officer, or director of the foreign charitable organization or representative.

Service of process is sufficient service on a foreign charitable organization or representative if:
service is made by the personal delivery and leaving of a copy of the process with the Secretary of State or the authorized representative of the Secretary of State; and
the Secretary of State sends a copy of the process by certified mail to the foreign charitable organization or representative at its last known address.
